ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Half an hour
0 - it was a seminar that involved no outside work
0 hour
Basically none, it's a seminar.Sometimes after class we would talk to the presenter or each out about the lecture.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Lectures were pretty boring on average. Presenters mostly just read data from power points. It would have been nice to get presenters who talked more about Envorinmental health as opposed to just read data.
Please have a wider array of subjects represented. Every speaker was from NCI. Not all of us are interested in environmental cancer epi. in fact most of us are interested in other things.
I hope we could invite more excellent researchers and speakers rather than PhD students whose work is not quite convincible.

It was interesting to learn about some contemporary issues and research in environmental health -- both within Yale and also from outside organizations. I now have a larger grasp of the field as a whole and a renewed interest in pursuing research of my own.Having some food there would be nice, especially since seminars in other divisions always provide food for attendees.
it's very informational and fun to learn about different topics~

It's a great seminar, some of the subjects were way over my head, and I wish that more EHS and forestry and Yale faculty came to present instead of people from other organizations. I appreciate some stuff from people from other organizations, but I would love to get to know the faculty here more and what they are doing and interested in! Requests for Michelle Bell and John Wargo for next fall!
Interesting class. I really enjoy listening to what people are doing in the field.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Yawei is very serious and patient.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  yawei is always there and asks quality questions for students~

Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Yawai is amazing. Approachable and knowledgeable and seems to know everything about the presentations and lectures before they are presented, as well as explaining some of the things that are above us at the time they are introduced. She is also approachable and is willing to talk to us after class (unfortunately that's not as common as you would hope).
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Great!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You get to listen to some interesting lectures related to environmental health.

I won't recommend this course to any students but I'll recommend them to stop by some interesting seminars as they like.This course depends on the seminar and the speakers. You can choose your interesting topics to listen.
It's required for all EHS students, but it's usually fine if you miss a few. Being able to eat your lunch there is a plus.
fun class to take / to socialize with EHS students~

Just show up, eat lunch, observe, and suck in information. It's great for deciding what you want to do after YSPH and determining what sort of research project you want to do for the summer. It's also a great way to get to know the faculty and staff in your department.
It's required, but I really like the lectures.
This class is good in that it allows the students to see what types of research are being done in other areas of academia.
